channel.title: Pickup Command
channel.description: How do i make it so i don't have to put two 0's in front of a 3-number ID for pickup? ex. ::pickup 00991 1

item.title: Pickup Command
item.dc:creator: @Anfernio Anfernio
item.description:
@Anfernio wrote:

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights >= 1)) { try { String[] args = command.split(" "); int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13)); if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("That item is non-existing. Please use an existing item id."); } } catch (Exception e) { sendMessage("SYNTAX - Exception: E. Try again later."); } }

O_O

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup Command
item.dc:creator: @maxxy2 maxxy2
item.description:
@maxxy2 wrote:

can you make it out of mine?

[code] if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerRights >= 1)) {
try {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12));
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));

            if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
            } else {
                sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist");
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("You suck at spawning. Do it again ! ");
        }
    }[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Pickup Command
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

if (command.startsWith("pickup")) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { msgToPlr("Item does not exist.."); } } else { msgToPlr("Invalid syntax! Use as ::pickup 995 10"); } }

Read full topic
